intro: Actinomeris pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered actinomeris, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
